steps.title: Visit nexusmods.com in your browser.
steps.content: Visit nexusmods.com in your browser. This is the foremost modding site and repository for Skyrim mods, and you'll find virtually all mods on it.

steps.title: Click LOG IN.
steps.content: Click LOG IN . You'll see this in the upper-right corner.

steps.title: Enter your email and password and click LOG IN
steps.content: Enter your email and password and click LOG IN

steps.title: If you do not have an existing account with nexusmods, click "Register here" link given below the login field.
steps.content: If you do not have an existing account with nexusmods, click "Register here" link given below the login field.

steps.title: Enter your email in the given field.
steps.content: Enter your email in the given field. Fill in Captcha verification and click VERIFY EMAIL .

steps.title: Check the verification email you receive.
steps.content: Check the verification email you receive. Copy the verification code provided in email.

steps.title: Fill in the verification code in the given fields and click VERIFY EMAIL.
steps.content: Fill in the verification code in the given fields and click VERIFY EMAIL .

steps.title: Fill out the account creation form.
steps.content: Fill out the account creation form. You'll need to enter a username and password and then click Create My Account .

steps.title: Choose a membership type.
steps.content: Choose a membership type. You don't need any of the paid packages to download mods. You can either choose paid membership plans or click the link at bottom "I'll stick with the basic membership" .

steps.title: Open Windows Explorer.
steps.content: Open Windows Explorer. You'll need to install Skyrim to a different folder than the usual Steam folder. This is because some mods have problems when accessing game files in the Program Files folder on your computer, which is the default installation location. You can click the Folder button in your taskbar or press ⊞ Win + E to open Windows Explorer.

steps.title: Open your hard drive.
steps.content: Open your hard drive. Double-click on your main drive to view it. This is typically the C: drive.

steps.title: Right-click and select New → Folder.
steps.content: Right-click and select New → Folder . This will create a new folder at the base of your hard drive.

steps.title: Name the folder Steam 2.
steps.content: Name the folder Steam 2 . You can name it anything, but this will help you identify it.

steps.title: Create another folder named Skyrim Mods.
steps.content: Create another folder named Skyrim Mods . This folder needs to be on the same drive as your new Steam 2 folder.

steps.title: Start Steam.
steps.content: Start Steam. Now that the folder is ready, you can add it to your Steam library so that you can install games to it.

steps.title: Click the Steam menu and select Settings.
steps.content: Click the Steam menu and select Settings .

steps.title: Click the Downloads tab and click Steam Library Folders.
steps.content: Click the Downloads tab and click Steam Library Folders.

steps.title: Click Add Library Folder.
steps.content: Click Add Library Folder .

steps.title: Browse for your newly-created folder.
steps.content: Browse for your newly-created folder. This folder will now be available to install Steam games to, including Skyrim.

steps.title: Right-click Skyrim in your Steam library and click Install.
steps.content: Right-click Skyrim in your Steam library and click Install . If it is already installed, you'll need to uninstall it first. Make sure you're installing standard Skyrim or the Legendary Edition. Most mods do not yet work with Skyrim Special Edition (Remastered). [1] X Research source

steps.title: Select your new folder from the Install under menu.
steps.content: Select your new folder from the Install under menu. Wait for the game to install.

steps.title: Visit the Mod Manager website.
steps.content: Visit the Mod Manager website. Visit nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1334/? to get a utility that allows you to easily organize your Skyrim mods.

steps.title: Click Download (Manual).
steps.content: Click Download (Manual) .

steps.title: Click the Mod Organizer v1_3_11 installer link.
steps.content: Click the Mod Organizer v1_3_11 installer link.

steps.title: Run the installer.
steps.content: Run the installer.

steps.title: Set the proper directory during installation.
steps.content: Set the proper directory during installation. When prompted to select where to install Mod Manager, point it to C:\Steam 2\steamapps\common\Skyrim or whichever folder you created earlier.

steps.title: Run Mod Organizer.
steps.content: Run Mod Organizer. You'll find this in your Skyrim directory.

steps.title: Allow Mod Organizer to handle NXM files when prompted.
steps.content: Allow Mod Organizer to handle NXM files when prompted. This will allow easy installation directly from the Nexus website.

steps.title: Visit the Skyrim Script Extender website.
steps.content: Visit the Skyrim Script Extender website. Go to skse.silverlock.org to download SKSE, a tweak that expands Skyrim's scripting, and is necessary for a large number of mods.

steps.title: Click the installer link.
steps.content: Click the installer link.

steps.title: Double-click the installer.
steps.content: Double-click the installer.

steps.title: Set the proper directory for SKSE.
steps.content: Set the proper directory for SKSE. When prompted during installation, point it at C:\Steam 2\steamapps\common\Skyrim .

steps.title: Start Mod Organizer from the Skyrim directory.
steps.content: Start Mod Organizer from the Skyrim directory.

steps.title: Click the drop-down menu.
steps.content: Click the drop-down menu. You'll find it next to "RUN."

steps.title: Click SKSE.
steps.content: Click SKSE . This will allow you to change the Mod Manager settings for SKSE.

steps.title: Click the "Edit" button.
steps.content: Click the "Edit" button.

steps.title: Set the location of SKSE.
steps.content: Set the location of SKSE. Point it to the skse_loader.exe file in your Skyrim folder. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Nexus Skyrim website.
steps.content: Open the Nexus Skyrim website. Visit nexusmods.com/skyrim/ to start browsing for mod files.

steps.title: Ensure you're signed in.
steps.content: Ensure you're signed in. You'll need to be signed in with your Nexus account in order to download mods larger than 2 MB, which is most of them.

steps.title: Find a mod you want to install.
steps.content: Find a mod you want to install. Browse the Nexus Skyrim mod database to find a mod that sounds interesting to you. There are countless mods available, but installation will usually be pretty similar for each thanks to Mod Organizer. Make sure to double-check the mod's description and instructions in case it relies on a mod you don't have installed yet or requires special installation.

steps.title: Click the Files tab.
steps.content: Click the Files tab. This will display the mod installation files.

steps.title: Click Download with Manager.
steps.content: Click Download with Manager. If the Download with Manager button is available, it will load directly into Mod Organizer. If you have to use an installer, make sure to point it to your Skyrim directory.

steps.title: Stick to one mod at a time at first.
steps.content: Stick to one mod at a time at first. As you get started trying out mods, it's best to stick to installing one at a time to help troubleshoot when your game invariably stops working.

steps.title: Run Mod Loader and select SKSE to start Skyrim.
steps.content: Run Mod Loader and select SKSE to start Skyrim. From now on, you'll be starting Skyrim through Mod Manager this way.
